intro: Crataegus aestivalis var. cerasoides, commonly known as the early summer hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters and features thorny branches with ovate, serrated leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers in early spring, followed by red or orange berries in the autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or hedgerows. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for both ornamental purposes and ecological habitats.
